IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL I CLASS MAGISTRATE-V,
(SPECIAL COURT FOR MARK LIST CASES), THIRUVANANTHAPURAM.
Present:- Smt. Aswathy.S, Judicial First Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
Monday the 27" day of January, 2025./ 7" Magha, 1946
CC. 2690/2018
Complainant : State represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Poonthura
Police Station in Crime No. 565/2012.
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused - Al. Sobhana, W/o. Sasi, Karthika Nivas, TC. 43/1070(3), Near
Marappalam Junction, Muttathara Ward, Muttathara Village.
(Abated).
A2. Rani, aged 33 years, D/o. Sasi, Karthika Nivas, TC.
43/1070(3), Near Marappalam Junction, Muttathara Ward,
Muttathara Village.
(By Advocate Sri. N. Akbar)
Charge : Offences punishable under sections 294(b) and 324 read with
section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.
Plea : Not guilty
Finding : Not guilty
Sentence : Accused No.2 is found not guilty of offences punishable under
sections 294(b) and 324 read with section 34 of Indian Penal
Code, 1860 and she is acquitted of the said offences under
section 248(1) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. Her bail
bond stand cancelled and she is set at liberty. Accused No. 1 is
reported no more. Hence charge against her is abated.

23.01.2025 24.01.2025 27.01.2025
This case having been finally heard on today the court on the same day delivered the
following :-
JUDGMENT

1. Accused stands trial for offences punishable under sections 294(b) and 324
read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. The prosecution case in brief is as follows :- Due to the prior enmity, on
29.06.2012, at 15.30 hours, the accused nos. 1 and 2 pelted brick pieces
against CW1, who was standing in the stair case of TC. 43/107(2), Chithra
Nivas, Marappalam, Muttathara Village, the house of PW1. It is alleged that
accused no.1 and 2 uttered obscene words against her. Thus accused committed

3 of 6
offences punishable under sections 294(b) and 324 read with section 34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860.

3. Final report was filed by the Sub Inspector of police, Poonthura police station
before the Hon'ble Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-II,
Thiruvananthapuram and the case was taken on file as C.C.1152/2012.
Cognizance was taken for the offences punishable u/ss. 294(b) and 324 read
with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 against the accused Nos. 1 and 2.
Thereafter, it was transferred to this court, in pursuance of the order of the
Hon'ble Chief Judicial Magistrate, Thiruvananthapuram, the case was refiled as
CC. 2690/2018.

4. On appearance of the accused No.2, she was enlarged on bail on 06.07.2012.
Copies of all relevant prosecution records were furnished to her under section
207 Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. After hearing prosecution and counsel
for accused No.2 charge framed for offences u/s. 294(b) and 324 read with
section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860, read over and explained to the accused
No.2 to which she pleaded not guilty and claimed to be tried. Accused No.1 is
reported no more. Death certificate produced verified and accepted. Hence
charge against her is abated.

5. On the side of prosecution, PW1 was examined and Ext. P1 was marked. As
the material witnesses failed to support the prosecution case, the learned

4 of 6

Assistant Public Prosecutor gave up the CW2 to CW5. In the absence of any

incriminating circumstances against the accused No.2 questioning of the

accused under section 313(1)(b) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973 was
dispensed with. Accused was called upon to adduce evidence but no defence
evidence was adduced from the side of the accused No2.

6. Heard both sides and perued records.

7. The following points have arisen for determination:

(1) Whether on 29.06.2012, at 15.30 hours, when CW1 along with her child
standing at the stair case of house, TC. 43/107(2), Chithra Nivas,
Marappalam, Muttathara Village, accused Nos. 1 and 2 in furtherance of
their common intention, uttered obscene words against PW1, which is in or
near public place and thereby accused no.2 committed an offence
punishable w/s. 294(b) read with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 ?

(2) Whether on the same day, at same time and place accused Nos. 1 and 2 in
furtherance of their common intention, pelted brick pieces towards PW1
and thereby accused committed an offence punishable u/s. 324 of Indian
Penal Code, 1860?

(3) If the accused No.2 is found guilty? What is the order as to sentence?

8. Point Nos. 1 and 2 :-To avoid repetition and for brevity, point numbers 1 and

2 are considered together. Prosecution case is that accused has committed

5 of 6
offences punishable under sections 294(b) and 324 read with section 34 of
Indian Penal Code, 1860.

9. PW1, Archana admitted the signature in the statement before the police in the
examination in chief and the statement was marked as Ext. P1. She deposed
that she has no grievance against the accused persons. According to her,
accused persons have not assaulted her as alleged by the prosecution and she
has no grievance against the accused persons and not interested to proceed with
the case.

10. The leamed Assistant Public Prosecutor had given up other witnesses and she
is justified in doing so as the material witness did not support the case of
prosecution. Having considered evidence on record, this court is of the view
that prosecution has failed to prove the guilt of accused. For the said reason
these points are found against the prosecution.

11. Point No. 3 :- Upon the finding in point nos. 1 and 2, the Accused No.2 is
found not guilty of offences punishable under sections 294(b) and 324 read
with section 34 of Indian Penal Code, 1860 and she is acquitted of the said
offences under section 248(1) Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973. Her bail
bond stand cancelled and she is set at liberty. Accused No. 1 is reported no
more. Hence charge against her is abated.

6 of 6
The brick pieces — 2 nos. were produced before this court as T No. 319/2012
will be destroyed after the appeal period is over according to law .
Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected by me
and pronounced in the open court on this the 27" day of January, 2025.
Sd/-
Judicial I Class Magistrate-V,
Thiruvananthapuram.
